description: Millions of years ago, the climate was much warmer and wetter than today. But exactly how much warmer and wetter?
title: The UK and Ireland's climate was tropical 26 million years ago—here's why that matters now

description: Earthquake scientists detected an unusual signal on monitoring stations used to detect seismic activity during September 2023. We saw it on sensors everywhere, from the Arctic to Antarctica.
title: The skyscraper-sized tsunami that vibrated through the entire planet and no one saw

description: A new study posits a very surprising answer to one of history's great mysteries—what killed off the Neanderthals?
title: Was a lack of get-up-and-go the death of the Neanderthals?

description: Mammals that can breathe through their backsides, homing pigeons that can guide missiles and sober worms that outpace drunk ones: these are some of the strange scientific discoveries that won this year's Ig Nobels, the quirky alternative to the Nobel prizes.
title: Backside breathing and pigeon bombers studies win Ig Nobel prizes

description: This week, a billionaire made a spacewalk, archaeologists found a new, isolated Neanderthal lineage and the James Webb Space Telescope revealed the extreme outskirts of the Milky Way. And a few other things happened:
title: Saturday Citations: Permian-Triassic mystery solved; cute baby sighted; the nine-day 2023 seismic event

description: This summer was the hottest on record worldwide, outpacing even last year's blistering temperatures, according to a new report by the European Union's Copernicus Climate Change Service.
title: Summer 2024 breaks record as hottest worldwide, new climate report shows

description: A US astronaut stuck on the International Space Station said Friday he believed Boeing's Starliner could have carried him home, if more time had been available to work through the beleaguered spacecraft's issues.
title: Boeing 'ran out of time' on Starliner: astronaut stuck on ISS

description: In the castle gardens of Muskauer Park, which straddles both banks of the German-Polish river border, caretakers have mounted a fightback against the impacts of climate change.
title: Germany's parks plant a way forward on climate change
